action_list.description: System action for creating an application

attrs.script:
#!/bin/sh

# make sure all base packages are updated
sudo yum -y update

# set the hostname as per the deployment settings
sudo hostnamectl set-hostname @@{HOSTNAME}@@-@@{calm_array_index}@@

#!/bin/sh

# make sure the hostname and IP address are in the local hosts file
# this is mandatory for a single instance Oracle deployment
echo "
@@{address}@@ @@{HOSTNAME}@@" | sudo tee -a /etc/hosts

#!/bin/sh

# install the Oracle dependencies
# this is easy on Oracle Linux but requires some tinkering on other distributions
# this will also create a user called 'oracle' and groups called 'oinstall' & 'dba'
sudo yum -y install oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall-1.0-6.el7.x86_64

#!/bin/sh

echo "# sysctl settings are defined through files in
# /usr/lib/sysctl.d/, /run/sysctl.d/, and /etc/sysctl.d/.
#
# Vendors settings live in /usr/lib/sysctl.d/.
# To override a whole file, create a new file with the same in
# /etc/sysctl.d/ and put new settings there. To override
# only specific settings, add a file with a lexically later
# name in /etc/sysctl.d/ and put new settings there.
#
# For more information, see sysctl.conf(5) and sysctl.d(5).

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for fs.file-max is 6815744
fs.file-max = 6815744

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for kernel.sem is '250 32000 100 128'
kernel.sem = 250 32000 100 128

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for kernel.shmmni is 4096
kernel.shmmni = 4096

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for kernel.shmall is 1073741824 on x86_64
kernel.shmall = 1073741824

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for kernel.shmmax is 4398046511104 on x86_64
kernel.shmmax = 4398046511104

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for kernel.panic_on_oops is 1 per Orabug 19212317
kernel.panic_on_oops = 1

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for net.core.rmem_default is 262144
net.core.rmem_default = 262144

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for net.core.rmem_max is 4194304
net.core.rmem_max = 4194304

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for net.core.wmem_default is 262144
net.core.wmem_default = 262144

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for net.core.wmem_max is 1048576
net.core.wmem_max = 1048576

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter is 2
net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter = 2

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter is 2
net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter = 2

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for fs.aio-max-nr is 1048576
fs.aio-max-nr = 1048576

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for net.ipv4.ip_local_port_range is 9000 65500
net.ipv4.ip_local_port_range = 9000 65500" | sudo tee -a /etc/sysctl.conf

#!/bin/sh

# create the bash profile script for the 'oracle' user
su - oracle -c 'echo "ORACLE_BASE=/u01/app/oracle; export ORACLE_BASE
GRID_HOME=/u01/app/11.2.0/grid; export GRID_HOME
DB_HOME=\$ORACLE_BASE/product/11.2.0/db_1; export DB_HOME
ORACLE_HOME=\$DB_HOME; export ORACLE_HOME
ORACLE_SID=orcl; export ORACLE_SID
DORACLE_TERM=xterm; export ORACLE_TERM
BASE_PATH=/usr/sbin:\$PATH; export BASE_PATH
PATH=\$ORACLE_HOME/bin:\$BASE_PATH; export PATH

LD_LIBRARY_PATH=\$ORACLE_HOME/lib:/lib:/usr/lib; export LD_LIBRARY_PATH
CLASSPATH=\$ORACLE_HOME/JRE:\$ORACLE_HOME/jlib:\$ORACLE_HOME/rdbms/jlib; export CLASSPATH

alias grid_env=\". /home/oracle/grid_env\"
alias db_env=\". /home/oracle/db_env\"
PATH=\$PATH:\$HOME/bin

PATH=.:\${JAVA_HOME}/bin:\${PATH}:\$HOME/bin:\$ORACLE_HOME/bin
PATH=\${PATH}:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/bin/X11:/usr/local/bin
PATH=\${PATH}:/u01/app/common/oracle/bin
export PATH

LD_LIBRARY_PATH=\$ORACLE_HOME/lib
LD_LIBRARY_PATH=\${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}:\$ORACLE_HOME/oracm/lib
LD_LIBRARY_PATH=\${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}:/lib:/usr/lib:/usr/local/lib
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH

CLASSPATH=\$ORACLE_HOME/JRE
CLASSPATH=\${CLASSPATH}:\$ORACLE_HOME/jlib
CLASSPATH=\${CLASSPATH}:\$ORACLE_HOME/rdbms/jlib
CLASSPATH=\${CLASSPATH}:\$ORACLE_HOME/network/jlib
export CLASSPATH

export THREADS_FLAG=native
export TEMP=/tmp
export TMPDIR=/tmp
umask 022" | tee ~/.bash_profile'

#!/bin/sh

# create the folder that will provide access to the mounted source files
sudo mkdir /source
sudo mount /dev/sdb1 /source

#!/bin/sh

# set all required variables in the Oracle install response file
sudo sed -i -- 's/oracle\.install\.option.*/oracle\.install\.option=INSTALL_DB_SWONLY/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/INVENTORY_LOCATION.*/INVENTORY_LOCATION=\/u01\/app\/oraInventory/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/UNIX_GROUP_NAME.*/UNIX_GROUP_NAME=oinstall/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/SELECTED_LANGUAGES.*/SELECTED_LANGUAGES=en,fr/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/oracle\.install\.db\.InstallEdition.*/oracle\.install\.db\.InstallEdition=EE/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/oracle\.install\.db\.isCustomInstall.*/oracle\.install\.db\.isCustomInstall=false/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/oracle\.install\.db\.OSDBA_GROUP.*/oracle\.install\.db\.OSDBA_GROUP=dba/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/oracle\.install\.db\.OSOPER_GROUP.*/oracle\.install\.db\.OSOPER_GROUP=dba/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/oracle\.install\.db\.OSBACKUPDBA_GROUP.*/oracle\.install\.db\.OSBACKUPDBA_GROUP=dba/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/oracle\.install\.db\.OSDGDBA_GROUP.*/oracle\.install\.db\.OSDGDBA_GROUP=dba/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/oracle\.install\.db\.OSKMDBA_GROUP.*/oracle\.install\.db\.OSKMDBA_GROUP=dba/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/SECURITY_UPDATES_VIA_MYORACLESUPPORT.*/SECURITY_UPDATES_VIA_MYORACLESUPPORT=false/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/DECLINE_SECURITY_UPDATES.*/DECLINE_SECURITY_UPDATES=true/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp

#!/bin/sh

# create the directory structure required to support this Oracle installation
sudo mkdir -p /u01
sudo chown -R oracle:oinstall /u01

#!/bin/sh

# with the response file, directory structure and source files prepared, we can install the Oracle application
# note that this process does not create any databases - we will do that later
su - oracle -c '/source/database/runInstaller -silent -responseFile /source/database/response/db_install.rsp'

#!/bin/sh

# the final step in the installation is to run the post-install *ROOT* only script
# in Calm, we want this to happen only after the Oracle database software has finished installing, which can take some time
# every 15 seconds, check to see if all 'oui' processes have finished
# if there's a single instance of 'oui' in the ps results, the installation has finished (the single instance is the ps grep command itself)
COUNT=0
while [ $COUNT != 1 ]
do
        COUNT=`sudo ps -aef | grep oui | wc | awk '{print $1;}'`
        echo "$COUNT oui processes found i.e. Oracle software install is still running ... will check again in 15 seconds ..."
        sleep 15
done

# all oui processes have finished - we can now run the post-install root script
source /home/oracle/.bash_profile
$ORACLE_HOME/root.sh

#!/bin/sh

# with the software installed and the post-install script run, we can create our database
# all settings are specified by application variables
su - oracle -c 'dbca -silent -createDatabase -templateName General_Purpose.dbc -gdbname @@{DATABASE_NAME}@@ -sid @@{DATABASE_NAME}@@ -responseFile NO_VALUE -characterSet AL32UTF8 -memoryPercentage 20 -emConfiguration NONE -sysPassword "@@{SYS_PASSWORD}@@" -systemPassword "@@{SYSTEM_PASSWORD}@@"'

#!/bin/sh

# make sure all base packages are updated
sudo yum -y update

# set the hostname as per the deployment settings
sudo hostnamectl set-hostname @@{HOSTNAME}@@-@@{calm_array_index}@@

#!/bin/sh

# make sure the hostname and IP address are in the local hosts file
# this is mandatory for a single instance Oracle deployment
echo "
@@{address}@@ @@{HOSTNAME}@@" | sudo tee -a /etc/hosts

#!/bin/sh

# install the Oracle dependencies
# this is easy on Oracle Linux but requires some tinkering on other distributions
# this will also create a user called 'oracle' and groups called 'oinstall' & 'dba'
sudo yum -y install oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall-1.0-6.el7.x86_64

#!/bin/sh

echo "# sysctl settings are defined through files in
# /usr/lib/sysctl.d/, /run/sysctl.d/, and /etc/sysctl.d/.
#
# Vendors settings live in /usr/lib/sysctl.d/.
# To override a whole file, create a new file with the same in
# /etc/sysctl.d/ and put new settings there. To override
# only specific settings, add a file with a lexically later
# name in /etc/sysctl.d/ and put new settings there.
#
# For more information, see sysctl.conf(5) and sysctl.d(5).

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for fs.file-max is 6815744
fs.file-max = 6815744

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for kernel.sem is '250 32000 100 128'
kernel.sem = 250 32000 100 128

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for kernel.shmmni is 4096
kernel.shmmni = 4096

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for kernel.shmall is 1073741824 on x86_64
kernel.shmall = 1073741824

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for kernel.shmmax is 4398046511104 on x86_64
kernel.shmmax = 4398046511104

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for kernel.panic_on_oops is 1 per Orabug 19212317
kernel.panic_on_oops = 1

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for net.core.rmem_default is 262144
net.core.rmem_default = 262144

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for net.core.rmem_max is 4194304
net.core.rmem_max = 4194304

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for net.core.wmem_default is 262144
net.core.wmem_default = 262144

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for net.core.wmem_max is 1048576
net.core.wmem_max = 1048576

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter is 2
net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter = 2

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter is 2
net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter = 2

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for fs.aio-max-nr is 1048576
fs.aio-max-nr = 1048576

# oracle-rdbms-server-12cR1-preinstall setting for net.ipv4.ip_local_port_range is 9000 65500
net.ipv4.ip_local_port_range = 9000 65500" | sudo tee -a /etc/sysctl.conf

#!/bin/sh

# create the bash profile script for the 'oracle' user
su - oracle -c 'echo "ORACLE_BASE=/u01/app/oracle; export ORACLE_BASE
GRID_HOME=/u01/app/11.2.0/grid; export GRID_HOME
DB_HOME=\$ORACLE_BASE/product/11.2.0/db_1; export DB_HOME
ORACLE_HOME=\$DB_HOME; export ORACLE_HOME
ORACLE_SID=orcl; export ORACLE_SID
DORACLE_TERM=xterm; export ORACLE_TERM
BASE_PATH=/usr/sbin:\$PATH; export BASE_PATH
PATH=\$ORACLE_HOME/bin:\$BASE_PATH; export PATH

LD_LIBRARY_PATH=\$ORACLE_HOME/lib:/lib:/usr/lib; export LD_LIBRARY_PATH
CLASSPATH=\$ORACLE_HOME/JRE:\$ORACLE_HOME/jlib:\$ORACLE_HOME/rdbms/jlib; export CLASSPATH

alias grid_env=\". /home/oracle/grid_env\"
alias db_env=\". /home/oracle/db_env\"
PATH=\$PATH:\$HOME/bin

PATH=.:\${JAVA_HOME}/bin:\${PATH}:\$HOME/bin:\$ORACLE_HOME/bin
PATH=\${PATH}:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/bin/X11:/usr/local/bin
PATH=\${PATH}:/u01/app/common/oracle/bin
export PATH

LD_LIBRARY_PATH=\$ORACLE_HOME/lib
LD_LIBRARY_PATH=\${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}:\$ORACLE_HOME/oracm/lib
LD_LIBRARY_PATH=\${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}:/lib:/usr/lib:/usr/local/lib
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH

CLASSPATH=\$ORACLE_HOME/JRE
CLASSPATH=\${CLASSPATH}:\$ORACLE_HOME/jlib
CLASSPATH=\${CLASSPATH}:\$ORACLE_HOME/rdbms/jlib
CLASSPATH=\${CLASSPATH}:\$ORACLE_HOME/network/jlib

export THREADS_FLAG=native
export TEMP=/tmp
export TMPDIR=/tmp
umask 022" | tee ~/.bash_profile'

#!/bin/sh

# create the folder that will provide access to the mounted source files
sudo mkdir /source
sudo mount /dev/sdb1 /source

#!/bin/sh

# set all required variables in the Oracle install response file
sudo sed -i -- 's/oracle\.install\.option.*/oracle\.install\.option=INSTALL_DB_SWONLY/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/INVENTORY_LOCATION.*/INVENTORY_LOCATION=\/u01\/app\/oraInventory/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/UNIX_GROUP_NAME.*/UNIX_GROUP_NAME=oinstall/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/SELECTED_LANGUAGES.*/SELECTED_LANGUAGES=en,fr/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/oracle\.install\.db\.InstallEdition.*/oracle\.install\.db\.InstallEdition=EE/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/oracle\.install\.db\.isCustomInstall.*/oracle\.install\.db\.isCustomInstall=false/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/oracle\.install\.db\.OSDBA_GROUP.*/oracle\.install\.db\.OSDBA_GROUP=dba/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/oracle\.install\.db\.OSOPER_GROUP.*/oracle\.install\.db\.OSOPER_GROUP=dba/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/oracle\.install\.db\.OSBACKUPDBA_GROUP.*/oracle\.install\.db\.OSBACKUPDBA_GROUP=dba/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/oracle\.install\.db\.OSDGDBA_GROUP.*/oracle\.install\.db\.OSDGDBA_GROUP=dba/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/oracle\.install\.db\.OSKMDBA_GROUP.*/oracle\.install\.db\.OSKMDBA_GROUP=dba/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/SECURITY_UPDATES_VIA_MYORACLESUPPORT.*/SECURITY_UPDATES_VIA_MYORACLESUPPORT=false/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp
sudo sed -i -- 's/DECLINE_SECURITY_UPDATES.*/DECLINE_SECURITY_UPDATES=true/' /source/database/response/db_install.rsp

#!/bin/sh

# create the directory structure required to support this Oracle installation
sudo mkdir -p /u01
sudo chown -R oracle:oinstall /u01

#!/bin/sh

# with the response file, directory structure and source files prepared, we can install the Oracle application
# note that this process does not create any databases - we will do that later
su - oracle -c '/source/database/runInstaller -silent -responseFile /source/database/response/db_install.rsp'

#!/bin/sh

# the final step in the installation is to run the post-install *ROOT* only script
# in Calm, we want this to happen only after the Oracle database software has finished installing, which can take some time
# every 15 seconds, check to see if all 'oui' processes have finished
# if there's a single instance of 'oui' in the ps results, the installation has finished (the single instance is the ps grep command itself)
COUNT=0
while [ $COUNT != 1 ]
do
        COUNT=`sudo ps -aef | grep oui | wc | awk '{print $1;}'`
        echo "$COUNT oui processes found i.e. Oracle software install is still running ... will check again in 15 seconds ..."
        sleep 15
done

# all oui processes have finished - we can now run the post-install root script
source /home/oracle/.bash_profile
$ORACLE_HOME/root.sh

#!/bin/sh

# with the software installed and the post-install script run, we can create our database
# all settings are specified by application variables
su - oracle -c 'dbca -silent -createDatabase -templateName General_Purpose.dbc -gdbname @@{DATABASE_NAME}@@ -sid @@{DATABASE_NAME}@@ -responseFile NO_VALUE -characterSet AL32UTF8 -memoryPercentage 20 -emConfiguration NONE -sysPassword "@@{SYS_PASSWORD}@@" -systemPassword "@@{SYSTEM_PASSWORD}@@"'
